Docs.summary: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface. When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page.
The properties of the FormViewDesigner class provide the following functionality:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property returns a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object, which typically contains an object that is derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class for each level in the inheritance tree of the designer.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> property returns a collection of formatting schemes for display in the **Auto Format** dialog box.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property returns a collection of template groups for the templates of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView>.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property always returns `true`, indicating that the designer creates a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> to generate the design-time markup.
The FormViewDesigner class methods provide the following functionality:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method returns the markup that is used to render the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> at design time.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView>.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.OnSchemaRefreshed%2A> method is called when the schema of the data source for the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> changes.
## Examples The following code example shows how to extend the FormViewDesigner class to change the appearance of controls that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control at design time.
The example derives the `MyFormView` control from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control. The `MyFormView` is simply a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView>. The example also derives the `MyFormViewDesigner` class from the FormViewDesigner and places a <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerAttribute> object for the `MyFormViewDesigner` on the `MyFormView` control.
The `MyFormViewDesigner` overrides the following items:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.SampleRowCount%2A> property to specify that the pager row for the design-time view of the `MyFormView` contain four page links.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to include the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView.Caption%2A> property, if it is specified, as a new first row in the `MyFormView` grid at design time. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> property of the `MyFormView` is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle> value, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> draws a blue dashed border around the control to make its extent more visible.

Docs.returns: A <xref:System.String> containing the markup used to render the at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If an item template has been defined for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control, the GetDesignTimeHtml method sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView.DataKeyNames%2A> collection of the control to an empty <xref:System.String> array if the schema for the data source cannot be obtained. The GetDesignTimeHtml refreshes the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> object to force a call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataBoundControlDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method. The GetDesignTimeHtml then calls the base method to generate the markup.
If no item template has been defined for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control, the GetDesignTimeHtml calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to generate markup that renders to a placeholder.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the GetDesignTimeHtml method in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner> class to change the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control at design time. The example adds a new first row to the grid to contain the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView.Caption%2A> property, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView.Caption%2A> is defined. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> property of the control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle> value, the GetDesignTimeHtml draws a blue dashed border around the control to make its extent more visible. The example does not change the run-time appearance of the control.

## Remarks The designer host calls the Initialize method when it is ready to use the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control. The Initialize and its base methods configure properties and connect to events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.
The `component` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control that is associated with this designer or a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The SampleRowCount always returns `2`. This causes two page links to be displayed in the pager row of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control at design time, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView.PagerSettings%2A> mode is numeric.

The example causes four page links to display.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The TemplateGroups property constructs a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> objects, one for each control template in the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control. The control templates are the header, footer, pager, item, edit item, insert item, and empty data. The control template <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> elements contain a single <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateDefinition> object.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a temporary copy rather than the actual control that is associated with the designer to generate the design-time markup.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Because the UsePreviewControl property is always true, the designer uses a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control that contains a copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control to generate the design-time markup. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control does not affect any persistence for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView>. If the UsePreviewControl property has been overridden to return `false`, the designer will use the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> itself to generate the design-time markup.
